item.title: News travels slow around here
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Techdirt.

New Petition Asks White House To Submit ACTA To The Senate For Ratification

As we noted in our post about people just discovering ACTA this week, some had put together an odd White House petition, asking the White House to "end ACTA." The oddity was over the fact that the President just signed ACTA a few months...

Read full topic

item.title: News travels slow around here
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:26, topic:430390”][quote]
Uhm, because of people like you who think we can just throw money at things and make problems go away. Also, when you refer to they, who do you mean by that? Authority in general? The US Government? It’s not the gov or even the country’s problem to deal with problems in Africa, just as Europe isn’t our problem to deal with (ACTA), and so on. The problem isn’t that our government isn’t involved enough, it’s that it’s too involved. To say otherwise and plead government support for Africa is completely contradictory.
[/quote]

Where did i say ‘Oh hey lets just throw some money at some people to get them to do what they want’? Never. There are other ways of sorting things out without spending money, and i refer to they as the people who decide on which bills to make and such.

It isn’t a countries problem to deal with another countries problem but we should because we’re ment to be advanced and help those less fortunite.

When a country makes a decision it affect the rest of us, as when America came up with SOPA.[/quote]

Psh. SOPA was a fucking cakewalk. This crap comes up every single year. Eventually it’s going to win.

Read full topic

I’ve no idea why you brought up belgium but lets go with it!

They’re always going ot be in debt because they aren’t trying to fix it, they’re too busy fixing usless things.[/quote]
Because I live in Belgium…

Read full topic

item.title: News travels slow around here
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Uhm, because of people like you who think we can just throw money at things and make problems go away. Also, when you refer to they, who do you mean by that? Authority in general? The US Government? It's not the gov or even the country's problem to deal with problems in Africa, just as Europe isn't our problem to deal with (ACTA), and so on. The problem isn't that our government isn't involved enough, it's that it's too involved. To say otherwise and plead government support for Africa is completely contradictory.

Where did i say ‘Oh hey lets just throw some money at some people to get them to do what they want’? Never. There are other ways of sorting things out without spending money, and i refer to they as the people who decide on which bills to make and such.

It isn’t a countries problem to deal with another countries problem but we should because we’re ment to be advanced and help those less fortunite.

When a country makes a decision it affect the rest of us, as when America came up with SOPA.

Read full topic

item.title: News travels slow around here
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:15, topic:430390”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=533074.msg3896859#msg3896859 date=1327375032]
Why are they so worried about the internet when there are more important things out there, you know like the debt porblem in america or the starving people in africa. Those have still yet to be fixed, they’re trying to fix things that aren’t broken.
[/quote][/quote]

Because they can’t get fixed,
90% of the money going to africa gets blocked by the local government and rebels to buy guns

There was an action recently in belgium against diarrhea in nepal,
Some guys of a magzine went their, appears that they don’t want any money, because of their believe they don’t take meds anyways,
and there wasn’t even a diarrhea problem.
It only feed the corrupt government and companies
While the government donated a bunch of money to the action for their “good name”
stupid people think they do good, but forgot that that money comes from their own pockets and goes nowhere

@dept, they always had debt and always will
the world is poisoned by money, corruption and power, there’s no solution
